title-group.article-title: Development of the Acousti-Cap TM Technology for Double-Layer Acoustic Liners in Aircraft Engine Nacelles

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2008 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Acoustically absorptive liners are used in the inlet and exhaust ducts of commercial aircraft engines. A double layer acoustic liner consists of a porous face sheet, a porous septum, an impervious back sheet, and a honeycomb structure. The Acousti-CapTM technology, developed by Hexcel Corporation, is a significant innovation in the manufacture of double layer acoustic liners. It consists of a non-metallic permeable cap material embedded into each cell of the honeycomb core to create an acoustic septum. This paper presents details of the extensive acoustic testing and analysis carried out to support the development of acoustic liners with embedded mesh-caps.
